msIdentifier.repository: Gonville and Caius College, Lower Library
msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50

summary.seg: This manuscript, like many others included in the Curious Cures in Cambridge Libraries project was once owned or used by Roger Marchall (c. 1417-1477) Rogerus Marshall (c. 1417-1477) , a doctor and physician to Edward IV who wrote his name in this manuscript 'R. Marchall' on p. 6. In common with numerous other manuscripts that he used or owned, Marchall added a selective table of contents to the beginning of the manuscript (p. 6) as well as rubrics and running headings for some of the treatises in the volume (see e.g., the upper margins of p. 81, 'Galienus de morbo et accidente', and 215, 'Tabula librorum Galieni'). Marchall's ownership or use of manuscripts is very well-attested, with forty-five surviving books (including this one) bearing evidence to connect him to them in some way; six others may have been his or accessed by him, and a further twelve are recorded but not traced.

As described by Linda Voigts, the present manuscript is one of eighteen (possibly nineteen) manuscripts at Gonville and Caius College that may be linked to Marchall, and which were probably donated by him to Gonville Hall (as Gonville and Caius then was); King's College and Peterhouse, where the study of medicine was also supported, received gifts of books from him too.

Thirteen manuscripts owned or used by Marchall (and another with possible Marchall connections) have been digitised, catalogued and conserved as part of the Curious Cures in Cambridge Libraries project:
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 59/153 (Voigts 1995, no. 2)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50 (Voigts 1995, no. 4)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 105/57 (Voigts 1995, no. 5)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 159/209 (Voigts 1995, no. 9)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 178/211 (Voigts 1995, no. 10)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 181/214 (Voigts 1995, no. 11)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 345/620 (Voigts 1995, no. 12)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 373/593 (Voigts 1995, no. 13)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 379/599 (Voigts 1995, no. 14)
Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 401/623 (Voigts 1995, no. 16)
Cambridge, Peterhouse, MS 95 (Voigts 1995, no. 24)
Cambridge, Peterhouse, MS 222 (Voigts 1995, no. 28)
Cambridge, Trinity College, MS O.8.31 (Voigts 1995, no. 29)
Cambridge, University Library, MS Add. 9213 (possible Marchall connections) (Voigts 1995, no. 48)

Dr Sarah Gilbert
Project Cataloguer for the Curious Cures Project
Cambridge University Library

References: See L. Voigts, 'A doctor and his books: the manuscripts of Roger Marchall (d. 1477)', in R. Beadle and A. J. Piper (eds.), New science out of old books: studies in manuscripts and early printed books in honour of A.I. Doyle (Aldershot, 1995) pp. 249-314

foliation.note: Numbering in ink in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos.
The paginator has skipped the numbers '113' and '114'. The paginator has skipped the leaf between p. 192 and p. 193, the pages of that leaf have been assigned the designations [192a] and [192b].

pp. [i]-[ii] and pp. [v]-[vi] are two modern paper flyleaves; pp. [iii]-[iv] and pp. 271-272 are manuscript fragments that originate from the same manuscript and have been reused as flyleaves for this manuscript.

signatures.p: Modern (20th-century) quire numbers in Arabic numerals on the lower right-hand corners of the first rectos of quires. Please note that this record counts pp. 1-6 as Quire 1 whereas the added quire numbers in the manuscript identify pp. 7-22 as Quire 1.

binding.p: (?)Eighteenth-century paneled brown calf consisting of an outer frame and central frame of triple blind-stamped lines with corner fleurons.

provenance.p: Roger Marchall (fl. 1436-1477), doctor of medicine Marchall, Roger, fl. 1436-1477: his name 'R. Marchall' inscribed on p. 6. See L. Voigts, 'A doctor and his books: the manuscripts of Roger Marchall (d. 1477)', in R. Beadle and A. J. Piper (eds.), New science out of old books: studies in manuscripts and early printed books in honour of A.I. Doyle (Aldershot, 1995) pp. 249-314

history.acquisition: Probably donated by Roger Marchall (fl. 1436-1477), doctor of medicine Marchall, Roger, fl. 1436-1477 to Gonville and Caius College with other manuscripts, but certainly in the college's library by the year 1600, when it was recorded as no. 13b in the Ecloga Oxonio-Cantabrigiensis by Thomas James (1600). Also no. 955 (see p. 1) in Bernard, Catalogi librorum manuscriptorum Angliæ et Hiberniæ (c. 1697); its armorial bookplate on a paper pastedown on the inside of the upper cover with the classmark number '50' written in red ink and '98' written in black ink.

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry partly draws on M. R. James, A descriptive catalogue of the manuscripts in the library of Gonville and Caius College, vol. 1 (Cambridge, 1908), pp. 105-106.

availability.p: Visitors to Gonville and Caius College who wish to consult Lower Library material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Gonville and Caius College: Library Information.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50, pp. [iii] recto-[iv] verso, 271-272

msItem.title: Office of St Cecilia (fragment)
msItem.incipit: [iv] [...] v[ersiculus] Tunc Valerianus perrexit ad antistitem et signum quod acceperat [...]

msItem.title: Office for All Saints or part of the Commune Sanctorum

extent.seg: Two parchment fragments that have been taken from the same manuscript and reused as flyleaves for this manuscript.

supportDesc.condition: The texts on pp. [ii] and 272 are much faded

layout.seg: Blind-ruled lines. The leaves have been heavily cropped, so it is not possible to give give accurate details about the dimensions of the text space or the number of lines to the page.

handNote.p: Copied by a single hand in a Carolingian minuscule.

decoNote.p: Syllable hyphenations and abbreviations for 'versiculus' and 'responsorium' written in red ink.

additions.note: Latin interlinear notes on p. 271 added in the (?) 13th century.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50, pp. 1-6

msItem.title: Medical tract on Menstruation
msItem.note: The names of medical authorities are written in the margin ('Bartholomeus', 'Trotula' 'Galienus' 'Gaddisden') but these have been partially cropped off.

msItem.title: Medical tract on the humour melencholia
msItem.note: The gathering of recipes is followed by one free-standing recipe
The names of medical authorities are written in the margin ('Gilbertus', 'Mesue', 'Lanfrancus', 'Rasis', 'Gaddisden') but these have been partially cropped off.

msItem.title: Medical tract on laxatives
msItem.incipit: 4 Laxatiuum dare conuenit dum luna est cancro uel pisce
msItem.note: The names of medical authorities are written in the margin ('[W]aynflett', 'johannes de sancto amando' 'ypocras', 'pulius walteri', 'holme', 'gilbertus', 'Gaddesden', 'Ardern', ) but these have been partially cropped off.

supportDesc.condition: Cockled leaves with stains that affect the legibility of the text.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame only. 47-50 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Copied by a single hand in a cursive script with both Anglicana and Secretary features.

decoDesc.p: This part of the manuscript does not contain any form of decoration.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50, pp. 7-214

msItem.title: De morbo et accidenti
msItem.author: Galen
msItem.rubric: 81 Galienus de morob et accidente [added title by Roger Marchall]
msItem.incipit: 81 In inicio huius libri diffinire morbum
msItem.explicit: 132 que accidentia semper alia sequntur et que non
msItem.finalRubric: 132 Explicit liber .G. de morbo et accidenti

msItem.title: De interioribus (tr. Burgundio of Pisa)
msItem.author: Galen
msItem.explicit: 214 et morbi que quidam in loco dicemus.
msItem.finalRubric: 214 Explicit liber G. de Interioribus et est magistri Helie de maioria Petragoricensis diocesis

collation.p:
Minor differences in page preparation, scribal hand, placement of catchwords and decoration between Quires 2-9 and Quires 10-14, but the continuation across both of a single series of medieval leaf signatures, points to these groups of quires having been made contemporaneously as codicological units.
Quires 2-88 (pp. 7-120)
Quire 96 (pp. 121-132) ;
Quires 10-138 (pp. (133-192, [192a]-[192b], 193-194)
Quires 1410 (pp. 195-214)

signatures.p: Leaf signatures consisting of combinations of letters ('a'-'l') and Roman numerals in quires 3-13, none in quire 2 and only Roman numerals in quire 14.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords in brown ink in the centre (Quires 2-8) and then the right-hand corner (Quires 10-13) of the bottom margin of the last verso of each quire.

supportDesc.condition: Cockled leaves some of which have been much affected by damp in their upper margins. There are various stains on p. 7.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame and line ruling. Double columns. 49 lines to the page, written below top line. Double vertical bounding lines in the outer margins in Quires 2-8 only.

handNote.p: Copied by two scribes (1: pp. 7-132; 2: pp. 133-214) writing in a script influenced by Southern Textualis.

decoNote.p: Large (6-8 lines) puzzle initials in blue and red at the beginnings of new works (pp. 7, 81, 133).
Small (2 lines) blue initials at the beginnings of new chapters throughout.

additions.note:
A Latin description of this volume's contents has been added by a 14th-century hand to 214: In isto volumine sunt libri sequentes Galieni: liber megategni
item de morbo et accidente
Item liber de interioribus.

origin.origDate: Copied in the second half of the 14th century

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50, pp. 215-262

msItem.title: Alphabetical index of medical subjects in the works of Galen
msItem.rubric: 215 Tabula librorum Galieni [added by Roger Marchall]
msItem.note: Both this item and the next item are part of the 'Concordantie Galieni' in a manuscript described in Valentin Rose, Verzeichniss der Lateinischen Handschriften der Königlichen Bibliothek zu Berlin, Zweiter Band: Die Handschriften der Kurfürstlichen Bibliothek und der Kurfürstlichen Lande, - Dritte Abteilung - (Die Handschriften-Verzeichnisse der Königlichen Bibliothek zu Berlin, Dreizehnter Band), Berlin: Asher, 1905: Berlin, Königliche Bibliothek, 902. lat. fol. 56 II, ff. 196r-293r.

msItem.title: Alphabetical lexicon for the works of Galen
msItem.incipit: 217 Abstinencia cibi nocet eis qui habent strictas uenas
msItem.note: Both this item and the prevoius item are part of the 'Concordantie Galieni' in a manuscript described in Valentin Rose, Verzeichniss der Lateinischen Handschriften der Königlichen Bibliothek zu Berlin, Zweiter Band: Die Handschriften der Kurfürstlichen Bibliothek und der Kurfürstlichen Lande, - Dritte Abteilung - (Die Handschriften-Verzeichnisse der Königlichen Bibliothek zu Berlin, Dreizehnter Band), Berlin: Asher, 1905: Berlin, Königliche Bibliothek, 902. lat. fol. 56 II, ff. 196r-293r.

signatures.p: Leaf signatures only in quire 16 (Arabic numerals '1'-'6').

supportDesc.condition: Cockled leaves with faded text on p. 215; the leaf that covers pp. 223-224 has a large horizontal tear in the middle that has been repaired with thread at the time of the manuscript's production. The leaves in this part feature many wormholes.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame and line ruling. Double columns, except for pp. 215 and 217which have 4 columns and pp. 216 which has 6 columns. 49 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Copied by two scribes (1: 215-217; 2: 217-262) producing a Northern Textualis script.

decoNote.p: Small (2 lines) initials in blue or red ink.
Marginal headers written in red ink.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 98/50 pp. 263-270

msItem.title: Anonymous commentary on the Prognostica [Liber prognosticorum] of Hippocrates (fragment)
msItem.incipit: 263 [A]cute egritudines in quatuordecim diebus indicantur 4b. Acute egritudines magne sunt et uelocem habent motum
msItem.explicit: 270 Et peryodis primus ex peryodis eorum ad

catchwords.seg: A catchword has been written in brown ink in the right-hand lower margin of p. 270.

supportDesc.condition: The leaves in this part feature many wormholes.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame nad line ruling. Single columns. 34-35 lines to the page, written above top line.

handNote.p: Copied by a single hand in an Anglicana script.

decoDesc.p: This part begins with a blank space that has been left for a decorated initial on p. 263 but does not feature any significant form of decoration.

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer, Cambridge University Library
